thread.title: Mullen's TD on final play gives Fenwick win over Austin Prep
thread.title_full: Mullen's TD on final play gives Fenwick win over Austin Prep

author: Matt Jenkins Staff writer
title: Mullen's TD on final play gives Fenwick win over Austin Prep
text:
Previous Next Mullen, Bright make the plays in Fenwick's thrilling win over Austin Prep 
Bishop Fenwick’s Will McGuiness reaches up over an Austin Prep defensive back to make a catch during the Crusaders’ 26-21 win Friday night. Rose Raymond photo. Mullen, Bright make the plays in Fenwick's thrilling win over Austin Prep 
Rose Raymond photoWill McGuiness, left, and Cody Mullen celebrate a Fenwick touchdown Friday night against Austin Prep. The Crusaders scored with no time left to defeat the Cougars, 26-21. Mullen, Bright make the plays in Fenwick's thrilling win over Austin Prep 
Cody Mullen hauls in one of his three touchdown catches Friday night for Bishop Fenwick. Mullen caught the game-winning touchdown with no time remaining to lift the Crusaders to a 26-21 win over Austin Prep. Rose Raymond photo. Mullen, Bright make the plays in Fenwick's thrilling win over Austin Prep 
Bishop Fenwick senior captain Cody Mullen hits the turf after making a big catch for the Crusaders Friday night against Austin Prep. Rose Raymond photo. Mullen, Bright make the plays in Fenwick's thrilling win over Austin Prep 
Cody Mullen (with ball) and Dan Hannon celebrate in the end zone after Mullen pulled down the game-winning touchdown catch in Fenwick's last-second 26-21 win over Austin Prep. Rose Raymond photo. Mullen, Bright make the plays in Fenwick's thrilling win over Austin Prep 
Bishop Fenwick sophomore running back Isaiah Cashwell-Doe cuts back during a fourth-quarter run Friday night against Austin Prep. Rose Raymond photo. Mullen, Bright make the plays in Fenwick's thrilling win over Austin Prep 
Bishop Fenwick defensive back Colin Norton tries to pull down Austin Prep running back Luke Wyman Friday night. Rose Raymond photo. Mullen, Bright make the plays in Fenwick's thrilling win over Austin Prep 
Bishop Fenwick senior wide receiver Cody Mullen runs by an Austin Prep defender Friday night. Rose Raymond photo. Mullen, Bright make the plays in Fenwick's thrilling win over Austin Prep 
Bishop Fenwick senior captain Cody Mullen walks off the field with the game ball. Mullen had nine catches for 133 yards and three touchdowns, including the game-winning score with no time remaining in Fenwick's 26-21 victory over Austin Prep. Rose Raymond photo. Mullen, Bright make the plays in Fenwick's thrilling win over Austin Prep 
Fenwick senior R.J. Libby makes a catch for a two-point conversion Friday night against Austin Prep. Rose Raymond photo. Posted: Saturday, October 10, 2015 12:00 am Mullen's TD on final play gives Fenwick win over Austin Prep By Matt Jenkins Staff writer Salem News 
PEABODY — It takes the wisdom and experience of a man who has been a high school football head coach for 37 years to perfectly sum up what happened last night on Bishop Fenwick’s Donaldson Field. 
“They’re the champs,” Austin Prep’s legendary coach Bill Maradei said about the Crusaders. “You want to beat the champions, boy you better make a play with five seconds left.” 
Austin Prep, at the time clinging to a one-point lead, could only watch in horror as Fenwick senior wide receiver Cody Mullen stepped in front of a Cougar defensive back and snatched freshman quarterback Cory Bright’s pass out of the air just over the goal line to give the Crusaders a stunning 26-21 victory in the final seconds. 
Mullen, a team captain, has been well entrenched as Fenwick’s play-maker since the beginning of the season, but now it seems he has some company in that category. 
With the game on the line, Fenwick coach Dave Woods felt comfortable putting the game in the hands of a freshman signal caller who has been splitting snaps at the position through the first five games. As for who was going to be targeted on the final play, there wasn’t much sideline debate. 
“The last play we said, ‘We’re throwing it to Cody.’ We tried to split the defenders a little and send Cody down the seam,” Woods said. “As soon as we broke the line, I could see the play develop and said to myself, ‘This is going to be a touchdown.’ Cody got position on him and he went up and made the play.” 
It was a play that seemed completely unlikely only 47 seconds before. 
Austin Prep’s Matt Liberacki scored on a 1-yard touchdown and Cougar quarterback Dan Monagle hit Luke Wyman for the two-point conversion, which put Fenwick behind 21-20 with only 47 seconds left. 
After a squibbed kickoff, Fenwick took over at its own 40 yard line. 
Bright threaded a needled on first down, hitting Isaiah Cashwell-Doe for a 24-yard gain. Three straight incomplete passes left Fenwick with a 4th-and-10 from the Austin Prep 36-yard line, and only 13 seconds remaining. 
Mullen snatched a first-down catch over the middle and Fenwick called timeout with five seconds left, setting up the game-winning score. 
“I just told (Cory) to throw the ball within five feet and I’d make the play,” Mullen said. “He threw it to the inside, I broke to the inside and I beat the kid to the ball. That’s about it; I just out-jumped him.” 
Bright did everything he was supposed to do on the play. He stood tall in the pocket while facing a heavy rush from Austin Prep, and threw the ball where Mullen could make a play. 
“I’ve never seen a quarterback with that composure, especially a freshman,” Mullen said. “The fourth quarter, the game’s on the line, last play of the game, it’s unbelievable. Really, the kid’s a stud.” 
Bright finished with 189 yards passing and four touchdowns, three to Mullen and one to Willie McGuiness for 28 yards that gave Fenwick a 20-13 lead in the fourth quarter. 
Mullen, meanwhile, had a monster game with nine catches for 133 yards. He also led the Crusaders in rushing with 43 yards on three carries, which included a first-down pickup on a fake punt. Mullen completed that play by hurdling an Austin Prep defender to gain the extra yards. 
Fenwick needed all the extra yards it could get against Austin Prep, which chewed up nearly all the first quarter while taking a 7-0 lead. The Cougars then scored quickly early in the fourth quarter, needing only three plays to go 73 yards to take a 13-12 lead. 
The Crusaders have a young team, but they stayed focused and got the stops and made the plays when they had to. 
“You really can’t give up. They had the ball for almost the whole first quarter. You can’t let it get to you that they keep getting first downs. All it takes is one big stop,” Mullen said. “I was trying to keep them all composed. They were starting to get nasty with each other. You gotta calm down in situations like that. As we just saw, you never know what’s going to happen. You just gotta play your game no matter what the situation is, no matter how much time is left on the clock, no matter what the score is. You just gotta do what you’re supposed to and let things play out.” Sign Up / Sign In
